Message.Issue: Initialize all static fields in 'POSSIBLE_OUTPUTS' when those fields are declared and remove the explicit static constructor.

Rule.Name: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Rule.Description: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences: {1}

Rule.Name: Initialize value type static fields inline
Rule.Description: Do not declare explicit static constructors on value types. Initializing static data in explicit static constructors results in a value type that is not marked in metadata as 'beforefieldinit'. In this case, the static constructor is not always guaranteed to be called before instance members on the value type are called.
Rule.Resolution: Initialize all static fields in {0} when those fields are declared and remove the explicit static constructor.
